definition: to avoid as taboo
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from
to be jealous of/fear/dread/scruple/to avoid or abstain from/to quit/to give up sth

sentences.english: Obama has never tried to hide his use of a teleprompter.
sentences.chinese: 奧巴馬從來沒有對於他用提詞器這方面有所避忌。

sentences.english: And Clinton vowed that she will not be " shying away from talking about human rights issues."
sentences.chinese: 希拉里發誓說，她將不會避忌談論有關人權問題。

sentences.english: Chinese advocate rich and varied affective life avoiding the monotonous.
sentences.chinese: 中國人的感情生活崇尚多味，避忌單一。

sentences.english: His breathing depends along the side of the expensive rare lips, let expensive living can not dodge to detest.
sentences.chinese: 他的氣息就靠在貴生的脣邊，讓貴生無法避忌。

definition: to avoid a taboo word or topic
to avoid a taboo word or topic/to refrain from/to avoid
to avoid arousing suspicion
to hold back from saying precisely what is on one's mind
all taboos are off (idiom); anything goes/nothing is taboo
to be secretive; to try to cover up (idiom)
to violate a taboo
taboo/to avoid as taboo/to abstain from
pompous/with a swagger/casual
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
bashful/blushing
to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
to be enraged
confident/calm/natural/poised
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
reserved/overcautious
intimate/taking liberties/familiar (with a negative connotation)
